Generate Custom Resume Tatari is on a mission to revolutionize TV advertising, working with various disruptor brands to enhance their business through innovative media solutions. The Research Data Scientist will collaborate with engineering teams to build predictive models and analyze data to optimize business strategies and redefine marketing analytics for TV and streaming media. Responsibilities
Collaborating closely with our engineering and technology teams, the Data Scientist will build predictive models, measurement algorithms, and deep analyses to provide insights for optimizing our business
Applying fluent understanding of state-of-the-art machine learning techniques to build predictive models and recommender systems
Applying deep understanding of statistics and probability to devise improvements to existing algorithms
Contributing to developing and maintaining internal analysis software libraries
Developing new intellectual property
Analyzing large amounts of data to identify relationships and trends, translating them into actionable insights for our product team and clients
Reporting findings, both orally and in writing
Qualification
Represents the skills you have Find out how your skills align with this job's requirements. If anything seems off, you can easily click on the tags to select or unselect skills to reflect your actual expertise. Machine Learning
Statistics
Data Manipulation
Python
SQL
Project Management
Communication Skills
Creativity
Required
Masters' degree in a technical field (e.g., Computer Science, Mathematics, Physics, Data Science, etc.)
Advanced experience in data manipulation tools (e.g., Python, pandas, pyspark, SQL)
Deep knowledge of statistics, probability, and machine learning techniques
Experience building/testing/validating ML models using state-of-the-art tech
Strong background designing and developing software to implement advanced analytic algorithms
A quick learner, with the ability to work independently and adaptably in a fast-paced environment
Strengths in creativity & open-ended problem-solving-- able to identify what's important (and not important) to focus on in order to construct effective approaches to challenging problems
Strong strategic thinking capabilities and project management skills
Strong communication skills, both written and oral
Preferred
PhD in a technical field
Industry experience with development and deployment of predictive models or recommendation systems
Benefits
Equity compensation
Health insurance coverage for you and your dependents
401K, FSA, and commuter benefits
$150 monthly spending account
$1,000 annual continued education benefit
$500 WFH reimbursement
Unlimited PTO and sick days
Monthly Company Wellness Day Off
Snacks, drinks, and catered lunches at the office
Team building events
Hybrid RTO of 2 days per week. THIS IS AN IN-OFFICE POSITION
